place.name: TREFDRAETH
place.gazetteerText: TREFDRAETH, a parish in the district and county of Anglesey; 2 miles ENE of Bodorgan r. station, and 5¾ SW of Llangefni. It contains Yard village, and has fairs on May and 1 Nov. Post town, Llangefni, Anglesey. Acres, 3,135. Real property, £3,333; of which £50 are in mines. Pop., 921. Houses, 208. The property is subdivided. The living is a rectory, united with Llan-gwyvan, in the diocese of Bangor. Value, £465.* Patron, the Bishop of B. The church is good. There are a Calvinistic Methodist chapel, and charities £6. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
